title: InputBinding

name: InputBinding
type: class
memorycategory: Instances
summary: |
  Defines which hardware binding should trigger the parent Class.InputAction.
description: |
  An InputBinding defines which hardware binding should trigger the parent
  Class.InputAction, for example a key press, gamepad button, or tap on a
  touchâ€‘enabled device. There can be multiple InputBinding instances parented
  to an Class.InputAction.
codesamples: []
inherits:
  - Instance
descendants: []
tags: []
deprecationmessage: ''
properties:
  - name: InputBinding.Backward
    summary: |
      Specifies an alternate Enum.KeyCode for dispatching directionally
      "backward" inputs to the parent Class.InputAction.
    description: |
      Specifies an alternate Enum.KeyCode for dispatching directionally
      "backward" inputs to Class.InputAction:GetState()|GetState() and the
      Class.InputAction.StateChanged|StateChanged event of the parent
      Class.InputAction. Only applies when the parent action's
      Class.InputAction.Type|Type is Enum.InputActionType|Direction3D, in
      which case the dispatched value will be a Datatype.Vector3 with its
      Datatype.Vector3.Z|Z component between 0 and 1.
    codesamples: []
    type: KeyCode
    tags: []
    deprecationmessage: ''
    security:
      read: None
      write: None
    threadsafety: ReadSafe
    category: Composite Directions
    serialization:
      canload: true
      cansave: true
    capabilities:
      - Input
  - name: InputBinding.Down
    summary: |
      Specifies an alternate Enum.KeyCode for dispatching directionally "down"
      inputs to the parent Class.InputAction.
    description: |
      Specifies an alternate Enum.KeyCode for dispatching directionally "down"
      inputs to Class.InputAction:GetState()|GetState() and the
      Class.InputAction.StateChanged|StateChanged event of the parent
      Class.InputAction.

      When the parent action's Class.InputAction.Type|Type is
      Enum.InputActionType|Direction1D, the dispatched value will be a number
      between 0 and -1.

      When the parent action's Class.InputAction.Type|Type is
      Enum.InputActionType|Direction2D, the dispatched value will be a
      Datatype.Vector2 with its Datatype.Vector2.Y|Y component between 0
      and -1.

      When the parent action's Class.InputAction.Type|Type is
      Enum.InputActionType|Direction3D, the dispatched value will be a
      Datatype.Vector3 with its Datatype.Vector3.Y|Y component between 0
      and -1.

      Not applicable when the parent action's Class.InputAction.Type|Type is
      Enum.InputActionType|Bool.
    codesamples: []
    type: KeyCode
    tags: []
    deprecationmessage: ''
    security:
      read: None
      write: None
    threadsafety: ReadSafe
    category: Composite Directions
    serialization:
      canload: true
      cansave: true
    capabilities:
      - Input
  - name: InputBinding.Forward
    summary: |
      Specifies an alternate Enum.KeyCode for dispatching directionally
      "forward" inputs to the parent Class.InputAction.
    description: |
      Specifies an alternate Enum.KeyCode for dispatching directionally
      "forward" inputs to Class.InputAction:GetState()|GetState() and the
      Class.InputAction.StateChanged|StateChanged event of the parent
      Class.InputAction. Only applies when the parent action's
      Class.InputAction.Type|Type is Enum.InputActionType|Direction3D, in
      which case the dispatched value will be a Datatype.Vector3 with its
      Datatype.Vector3.Z|Z component between 0 and -1.
    codesamples: []
    type: KeyCode
    tags: []
    deprecationmessage: ''
    security:
      read: None
      write: None
    threadsafety: ReadSafe
    category: Composite Directions
    serialization:
      canload: true
      cansave: true
    capabilities:
      - Input
  - name: InputBinding.KeyCode
    summary: |
      Specifies the Enum.KeyCode which triggers the parent
      Class.InputAction.
    description: |
      Specifies the Enum.KeyCode which triggers the parent
      Class.InputAction. The code type should match the input action's
      Class.InputAction.Type|Type, for example Enum.KeyCode.E for an action
      type of Enum.InputActionType|Bool or Enum.KeyCode.Thumbstick1 for an
      action type of Enum.InputActionType|Direction2D. Type mismatches will
      either not fire the Class.InputAction or the
      Class.InputAction.StateChanged|StateChanged event will receive a
      converted value.
    codesamples: []
    type: KeyCode
    tags: []
    deprecationmessage: ''
    security:
      read: None
      write: None
    threadsafety: ReadSafe
    category: Behavior
    serialization:
      canload: true
      cansave: true
    capabilities:
      - Input
  - name: InputBinding.Left
    summary: |
      Specifies an alternate Enum.KeyCode for dispatching directionally "left"
      inputs to the parent Class.InputAction.
    description: |
      Specifies an alternate Enum.KeyCode for dispatching directionally "left"
      inputs to Class.InputAction:GetState()|GetState() and the
      Class.InputAction.StateChanged|StateChanged event of the parent
      Class.InputAction.

      When the parent action's Class.InputAction.Type|Type is
      Enum.InputActionType|Direction2D, the dispatched value will be a
      Datatype.Vector2 with its Datatype.Vector2.X|X component between 0
      and -1.

      When the parent action's Class.InputAction.Type|Type is
      Enum.InputActionType|Direction3D, the dispatched value will be a
      Datatype.Vector3 with its Datatype.Vector3.X|X component between 0
      and -1.

      Not applicable when the parent action's Class.InputAction.Type|Type is
      Enum.InputActionType|Direction1D or Enum.InputActionType|Bool.
    codesamples: []
    type: KeyCode
    tags: []
    deprecationmessage: ''
    security:
      read: None
      write: None
    threadsafety: ReadSafe
    category: Composite Directions
    serialization:
      canload: true
      cansave: true
    capabilities:
      - Input
  - name: InputBinding.PressedThreshold
    summary: |
      Numerical value above which to fire an Class.InputAction with a
      Class.InputAction.Type|Type of Enum.InputActionType|Bool.
    description: |
      Numerical value above which to fire an Class.InputAction with a
      Class.InputAction.Type|Type of Enum.InputActionType|Bool, for example
      when a gamepad trigger such as Enum.KeyCode.ButtonL2 exceeds 0.5
      (halfway pressed). Default is 0.5.

      This property must be greater than or equal to
      Class.InputBinding.ReleasedThreshold|ReleasedThreshold or else it will
      be clamped to Class.InputBinding.ReleasedThreshold|ReleasedThreshold.
    codesamples: []
    type: float
    tags: []
    deprecationmessage: ''
    security:
      read: None
      write: None
    threadsafety: ReadSafe
    category: Behavior
    serialization:
      canload: true
      cansave: true
    capabilities:
      - Input
  - name: InputBinding.PrimaryModifier
    summary: |
      Specifies a primary Enum.KeyCode that must be pressed for the binding to
      activate.
    description: |
      Specifies a Enum.KeyCode that serves as a required modifier for the
      binding. The Class.InputBinding will only trigger the parent
      Class.InputAction if this input is pressed prior to
      Class.InputBinding.KeyCode|KeyCode,
      Class.InputBinding.UIButton|UIButton, or composite directions.

      There is no ordering requirement between
      Class.InputBinding.PrimaryModifier|PrimaryModifier and
      Class.InputBinding.SecondaryModifier|SecondaryModifier. If both
      properties are set, both modifiers must be pressed to activate the
      binding, but the order in which they are pressed does not matter.

      If set to Enum.KeyCode.Unknown, no primary modifier is required.
    codesamples: []
    type: KeyCode
    tags: []
    deprecationmessage: ''
    security:
      read: None
      write: None
    threadsafety: ReadSafe
    category: Behavior
    serialization:
      canload: true
      cansave: true
    capabilities:
      - Input
  - name: InputBinding.ReleasedThreshold
    summary: |
      Numerical value below which to fire an Class.InputAction with a
      Class.InputAction.Type|Type of Enum.InputActionType|Bool.
    description: |
      Numerical value below which to fire an Class.InputAction with a
      Class.InputAction.Type|Type of Enum.InputActionType|Bool, for example
      when a gamepad trigger such as Enum.KeyCode.ButtonL2 falls below 0.5
      (less than halfway pressed). Default is 0.2.

      This property must be less than or equal to
      Class.InputBinding.PressedThreshold|PressedThreshold or else it will be
      clamped to Class.InputBinding.PressedThreshold|PressedThreshold.
    codesamples: []
    type: float
    tags: []
    deprecationmessage: ''
    security:
      read: None
      write: None
    threadsafety: ReadSafe
    category: Behavior
    serialization:
      canload: true
      cansave: true
    capabilities:
      - Input
  - name: InputBinding.ResponseCurve
    summary: |
      Numerical value to configure scaling for more precise thumbstick aiming.
    description: |
      A numerical value to control the sensitivity of gamepad thumbstick input
      by applying a quadratic response curve. Commonly used for camera control
      to make small thumbstick inputs more precise, while ramping up quickly to
      allow for large movements with higher magnitude input.

      Ranges between 1 to 10, with higher values providing a more intense
      curve. Default is 1, at which input is returned exactly as received.

      Only applicable when the parent action's Class.InputAction.Type|Type is
      Enum.InputActionType|Direction2D and the
      Class.InputBinding.KeyCode|KeyCode is
      Enum.KeyCode.Thumbstick1|Thumbstick1 or
      Enum.KeyCode.Thumbstick2|Thumbstick2.
    codesamples: []
    type: float
    tags: []
    deprecationmessage: ''
    security:
      read: None
      write: None
    threadsafety: ReadSafe
    category: Behavior
    serialization:
      canload: true
      cansave: true
    capabilities:
      - Input
  - name: InputBinding.Right
    summary: |
      Specifies an alternate Enum.KeyCode for dispatching directionally
      "right" inputs to the parent Class.InputAction.
    description: |
      Specifies an alternate Enum.KeyCode for dispatching directionally
      "right" inputs to Class.InputAction:GetState()|GetState() and the
      Class.InputAction.StateChanged|StateChanged event of the parent
      Class.InputAction.

      When the parent action's Class.InputAction.Type|Type is
      Enum.InputActionType|Direction2D, the dispatched value will be a
      Datatype.Vector2 with its Datatype.Vector2.X|X component between 0
      and 1.

      When the parent action's Class.InputAction.Type|Type is
      Enum.InputActionType|Direction3D, the dispatched value will be a
      Datatype.Vector3 with its Datatype.Vector3.X|X component between 0
      and 1.

      Not applicable when the parent action's Class.InputAction.Type|Type is
      Enum.InputActionType|Direction1D or Enum.InputActionType|Bool.
    codesamples: []
    type: KeyCode
    tags: []
    deprecationmessage: ''
    security:
      read: None
      write: None
    threadsafety: ReadSafe
    category: Composite Directions
    serialization:
      canload: true
      cansave: true
    capabilities:
      - Input
  - name: InputBinding.Scale
    summary: |
      Amount by which to linearly scale the values of a directional
      Class.InputAction.
    description: |
      Amount by which to linearly scale the values of an Class.InputAction
      with Class.InputAction.Type|Type of Enum.InputActionType|Direction1D,
      Enum.InputActionType|Direction2D, or Enum.InputActionType|Direction3D.
    codesamples: []
    type: float
    tags: []
    deprecationmessage: ''
    security:
      read: None
      write: None
    threadsafety: ReadSafe
    category: Behavior
    serialization:
      canload: true
      cansave: true
    capabilities:
      - Input
  - name: InputBinding.SecondaryModifier
    summary: |
      Specifies a secondary Enum.KeyCode that must be pressed for the binding
      to activate.
    description: |
      Specifies a Enum.KeyCode that serves as a required modifier for the
      binding. The Class.InputBinding will only trigger the parent
      Class.InputAction if this input is pressed prior to
      Class.InputBinding.KeyCode|KeyCode,
      Class.InputBinding.UIButton|UIButton, or composite directions.

      There is no ordering requirement between
      Class.InputBinding.PrimaryModifier|PrimaryModifier and
      Class.InputBinding.SecondaryModifier|SecondaryModifier. If both
      properties are set, both modifiers must be pressed to activate the
      binding, but the order in which they are pressed does not matter.

      If set to Enum.KeyCode.Unknown, no secondary modifier is required.
    codesamples: []
    type: KeyCode
    tags: []
    deprecationmessage: ''
    security:
      read: None
      write: None
    threadsafety: ReadSafe
    category: Behavior
    serialization:
      canload: true
      cansave: true
    capabilities:
      - Input
  - name: InputBinding.UIButton
    summary: |
      Connects a Class.GuiButton to a boolean action.
    description: |
      Class.GuiButton to connect to a boolean action.
    codesamples: []
    type: GuiButton
    tags: []
    deprecationmessage: ''
    security:
      read: None
      write: None
    threadsafety: ReadSafe
    category: Behavior
    serialization:
      canload: true
      cansave: true
    capabilities:
      - Input
  - name: InputBinding.Up
    summary: |
      Specifies an alternate Enum.KeyCode for dispatching directionally "up"
      inputs to the parent Class.InputAction.
    description: |
      Specifies an alternate Enum.KeyCode for dispatching directionally "up"
      inputs to Class.InputAction:GetState()|GetState() and the
      Class.InputAction.StateChanged|StateChanged event of the parent
      Class.InputAction.

      When the parent action's Class.InputAction.Type|Type is
      Enum.InputActionType|Direction1D, the dispatched value will be a number
      between 0 and 1.

      When the parent action's Class.InputAction.Type|Type is
      Enum.InputActionType|Direction2D, the dispatched value will be a
      Datatype.Vector2 with its Datatype.Vector2.Y|Y component between 0
      and 1.

      When the parent action's Class.InputAction.Type|Type is
      Enum.InputActionType|Direction3D, the dispatched value will be a
      Datatype.Vector3 with its Datatype.Vector3.Y|Y component between 0
      and 1.

      Not applicable when the parent action's Class.InputAction.Type|Type is
      Enum.InputActionType|Bool.
    codesamples: []
    type: KeyCode
    tags: []
    deprecationmessage: ''
    security:
      read: None
      write: None
    threadsafety: ReadSafe
    category: Composite Directions
    serialization:
      canload: true
      cansave: true
    capabilities:
      - Input
  - name: InputBinding.Vector2Scale
    summary: |
      Amount by which to linearly scale the values of a two-directional
      Class.InputAction.
    description: |
      Amount by which to linearly scale the values of an Class.InputAction
      with Class.InputAction.Type|Type of Enum.InputActionType|Direction2D.
    codesamples: []
    type: Vector2
    tags: []
    deprecationmessage: ''
    security:
      read: None
      write: None
    threadsafety: ReadSafe
    category: Behavior
    serialization:
      canload: true
      cansave: true
    capabilities:
      - Input
  - name: InputBinding.Vector3Scale
    summary: ''

    codesamples: []
    type: Vector3
    tags: []

    security:
      read: None
      write: None
